mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Thomas Law to John Law, 1804 September 4
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Law, Thomas, 1756-1834
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Thomas Law writes to his son John Law discussing his separation from wife Eliza Parke Custis Law, includes the Latin phrase -' quicquid corrigere est nefas levius fit patientia'; encourages John to take an oath of allegiance to America; dismayed by the conflict between Great Britain and France; spent time at Bath [Berkeley Springs] to ease his ill health; stayed with Gov. Lee [Thomas Sims Lee] near Harpers Ferry; speaks highly of Lee's son; encourages John to avoid the 'thoughtless simpletons' of his generation. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, integral address panel. Partial loss from wax seal.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Law, Elizabeth Parke Custis, 1776-1831
